alert.note: Alert for Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 7:23PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Suwannee County through 800 PM EDT... At 723 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Dowling Park, or 10 miles northwest of Mayo, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Wellborn, Dowling Park, Obrien, Mcalpin, Luraville, Branford, Hildreth and Houston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern Florida. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Florida.
